notes.title: Images in React
notes.author: Steve
notes.content:
Images have to be imported, not just pointed at.

ex: `import image from './filepath'`

"import", "image" and "from" are all fixed, the filepath is variable

notes.title: Functions as Props
notes.author: Steve
notes.content: When passing a callback function as a prop {functionName()} will invoke it immediately, but {() => functionName()} won't

notes.title: setState() Tip
notes.author: Steve
notes.content:
setState() just makes state equal to whatever is in the parens.

ex: `setState(true)` is the same as `let setState = true`

notes.title: Workflow Tip
notes.author: Steve
notes.content: When your're coding, just console.log() stuff. Keep your flow going. console.log(fetchtarget) is fun.

notes.title: Props explained
notes.author: Steve
notes.content:
When you say <ComponentName x={propName}>, you're actually making a key value pair. Everything is in the props object, passing down to the called child component.

ex: <... value=  type= etc.

notes.title: Make a branch in Git
notes.author: Steve
notes.content:
If you want to move to a branch that already exists, `git checkout branchname` will get you there.
If you want to create and move to a new branch `git checkout -b branchname`

notes.title: Overflow uses
notes.author: Jak
notes.content: Use the properties of white-space overflow and text overflow to create a preview of text

notes.title: Vertical percentage quirk
notes.author: Steve
notes.content: Vertical percentages are relative to container width, not height

notes.title: Rails test
notes.author: Steve
notes.content: This is a test to see if the rails tag is working. Ignore me plz

notes.title: The wrong Ruby
notes.author: Steve
notes.content: A ruby is a pink to blood-red colored gemstone, a variety of the mineral corundum.
